snippet: In a video posted online, a prosecutor, Franklin Nieves, criticizes a trial in which he helped convict Leopoldo López, calling it a farce, and says he has left Venezuela.

byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Mexico City, and Patricia Torres from Caracas, Venezuela.
byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and PATRICIA TORRES

abstract: Venezuelans are stunned at news that prosecutor Franklin Nieves has released video admitting he was complicit in false conviction of opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez and has fled country as result.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: In a video posted online, a prosecutor, Franklin Nieves, criticizes a trial in which he helped convict Leopoldo López, calling it a farce, and says he has left Venezuela.

headline.print_headline: Venezuelan Prosecutor Says Opposition Leader’s Trial Was a Farce
headline.main: Venezuelan Prosecutor Says Opposition Leader’s Trial Was a Farce
